entry.summary:
In the world of technology, Twilio has recently reminded its users that the Authy Desktop apps will be discontinued next month, contrary to previous information stating it would happen in August. This update serves as a reminder for users to make necessary arrangements and find alternative solutions for their authentication needs. Additionally, there is news regarding the online database move and copy feature for SQL Managed Instance, which is currently in its private preview stage. This new tool aims to provide users with a seamless and efficient way to manage their databases, offering convenience and improved functionality. However, there have been reports of inconsistent behavior from the OLE DB provider "MSDASQL" for a linked server, causing concerns among users. This issue needs to be addressed to ensure the smooth functioning of database operations. On a different note, Intuitive Machines' lunar lander has embarked on its multi-day journey to the moon. This significant milestone in space exploration showcases the advancements made in aerospace technology and paves the way for future lunar missions. Lastly, SpaceX has announced its plan to remove 100 satellites from the Starlink constellation due to the risk of failure. This decision highlights the company's commitment to maintaining the reliability and functionality of its satellite network.
